Description: Rim and body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery Komast cup; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed black below; exterior: on lip, net pattern between brownish bands; black-figure decoration consisting of parts of three male revellers dancing and holding drinking horns; from left, top of komast’s head (fillet in added red) and hand holding drinking horn with red rim, to right; upper part of youth looking to left (fillet in red, hair tied back with red on knotted end); of third figure, right hand holding drinking horn, to left.
Curator's comments: For parallels, see Athens, NM inv. 649 in ABV, 34, no. 3 and Otterlo 58 in Brijder, H. A. G., Siana Cups I and Komast Cups. Amsterdam 1983, pl. 5a, no. K 57. On the Falmouth Painter, see Brijder 1983, 76-9 and for the net pattern, see fig. 17d.
